paramInformation.label: Overcurrent Protection
paramInformation.description: Smart plug keep detecting the load power, once the ac current exceeds 16.5a for more than 4 seconds, smart plug's relay will turn off

paramInformation.label: Setting The Parameters 101~104 to The Default States
Setting Time For Sending Meter Report (watt)
paramInformation.description: The interval time of sending meter report (watt) to associated device (group lifeline)

paramInformation.label: Setting Time For Sending Meter Report (kwh)
paramInformation.description: The interval of sending meter report (kwh) to association device (group lifeline)

paramInformation.label: Setting Time For Sending Meter Report (voltage)
paramInformation.description: The interval of sending meter report (voltage) to association device (group lifeline)

paramInformation.label: Setting Time For Sending Meter Report (current)
paramInformation.description: The interval time of sending meter report (current) to associated device (group lifeline)

paramInformation.label: The Value Here Represents Minimum Change in Wattage (in Terms of Wattage) For a Meter Report to Be Sent
paramInformation.description: When the change value of load power exceeds the setting value, smart plug will send meter report (watt) to associated device (group lifeline)

paramInformation.label: The Value Here Represents Minimum Change in Wattage Percent (in Terms of Percentage) For a Meter Report (watt) to Be Sent
paramInformation.description: When the change value of the load power exceeds the setting value, smart plug will send meter report to associated device (group lifeline)

paramInformation.label: Setting Device Status After Power Failure
paramInformation.description: Define how the plug reacts after the power supply is back on

options.label: Smart plug memorizes its state after a power failure
Smart plug does not memorize its state after a power failure. connected device will be on after the power supply is reconnected
Smart plug does not memorize its state after a power failure. connected device will be off after the power supply is reconnected

paramInformation.label: Notification When Load Status Change
paramInformation.description: Smart plug can send notifications to associated device (group lifeline) when the status of smart plug’s load is changed

options.label: The LED status follows the load change
When operating the load, the LED lights for 5 seconds and then turns off

paramInformation.label: Led Load Indicator Mode Selection
paramInformation.description: Configure LED display mode to prevent light pollution at night

options.label: The LED status follows the load change
When operating the load, the LED lights for 5 seconds and then turns off

metadata.inclusion:
To add the product to the Z-Wave network:
a. Make sure that the Smart Plug has been connected to the power supply.
b. Set the Z-Wave network main controller into inclusion mode.
c. Power on.
d. The LED will blink fast until the inclusion is completed and then the LED will keep turning on or off. Otherwise, the LED will still blink slowly, in which you need to repeat the process from step b
metadata.exclusion:
To remove the product from the Z-Wave network:
a. Insert the Smart Plug to power socket, the LED will follow the status (on or off) of its load’s power level.
b. Set the Z-Wave network main controller into exclusion mode.
c. Short press Button 3 times within 1.5 second.
d. The LED will blink fast until the exclusion is completed, then the LED will keep on blinking slowly. Otherwise, the LED will keep on blink fast for 35 seconds and then follow the status (on or off) of its load status
metadata.reset:
Reset Smart Plug to factory default:
1. Make sure that the Smart Plug has been connected to the power supply.
2. Press and hold the Button for 5 seconds.
3. If holding time is more than one second, the LED will blink faster and faster. If holding time is more than 5 seconds, the LED will be solid for 3 seconds to indicate that the resetting is successful. Otherwise, repeat step 2.
Note:
Reset to factory will remove Smart Plug from the Z-Wave network. Use this procedure only in the event that the network primary controller missing or otherwise inoperable
